title: Authors and Citation
text: Judit Kisistok. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kisistok J (2023). ggAU: ggplot2 themes Aarhus University. R package version 1.0.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ggAU: ggplot2 themes for Aarhus University},   author = {Judit Kisistok},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.0.0}, }

title: ggplot2 themes for Aarhus University
text: goal ggAU simplify process creating publication-ready visualizations follow Aarhus University color scheme. also includes color scheme inspired TRACERx publications.

title: ggplot2 themes for Aarhus University
text: can install development version ggAU GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("juditkisistok/ggAU")

title: ggplot2 themes for Aarhus University
code: library(ggAU) unikn::seecol(au_color_palette(style = "light"), main = "Light",                grid = F, rgb = F) unikn::seecol(au_color_palette(style = "dark"), main = "Dark",                grid = F, rgb = F) unikn::seecol(au_color_palette(style = "hotandcold"), main = "Hot and cold",                grid = F, rgb = F) unikn::seecol(au_color_palette(style = "hotandcold_dark"), main = "Hot and cold (dark)",                grid = F, rgb = F) unikn::seecol(au_color_palette(style = "tracerx"), main = "TRACERx",                grid = F, rgb = F)

title: ggplot2 themes for Aarhus University
text: scale_fill_au scale_color_au functions allow apply pre-defined color palettes. default color scheme light default variable type continuous. can add discrete = T categorical variable color schemes.  also possible define mix colors - can retrieve vector AU hex codes color name.  continuous fill scale works similar way, built-custom color schemes.  color aesthetic can changed similar way, using scale_color_au.
code: iris_df = dplyr::summarize(dplyr::group_by(iris, Species),                             `Mean petal width` = mean(Petal.Width))  light_plot_fill = ggplot2::ggplot(iris_df, ggplot2::aes(x = Species,                                        y = `Mean petal width`, fill = Species)) +   ggplot2::geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   ggpubr::theme_pubr() +   scale_fill_au(discrete = T)  dark_plot_fill = ggplot2::ggplot(iris_df, ggplot2::aes(x = Species,                                       y = `Mean petal width`, fill = Species)) +   ggplot2::geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   ggpubr::theme_pubr() +   scale_fill_au(discrete = T, style = "dark")  cowplot::plot_grid(light_plot_fill, dark_plot_fill) my_custom_style = c("blue", "yellow", "red")  ggplot2::ggplot(iris_df, ggplot2::aes(x = Species,                                        y = `Mean petal width`, fill = Species)) +   ggplot2::geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   ggpubr::theme_pubr() +   scale_fill_au(discrete = T, style = "custom", colors = my_custom_style) dummy_data = expand.grid(x = paste0("var_", seq(1, 10)),                           y = paste0("var_", seq(11, 20))) dummy_data$z = runif(100, -1, 1)  cont_fill_1 = ggplot2::ggplot(dummy_data, ggplot2::aes(x, y, fill = z)) +   ggplot2::geom_tile() +   ggpubr::theme_pubr() +   scale_fill_au(style = "hotandcold")  cont_fill_2 = ggplot2::ggplot(dummy_data, ggplot2::aes(x, y, fill= z)) +   ggplot2::geom_tile() +   ggpubr::theme_pubr() +   scale_fill_au(style = "custom", colors = c("yellow", "white", "darkblue"))  cowplot::plot_grid(cont_fill_1, cont_fill_2) discrete_cols = ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(x = Petal.Width, y = Petal.Length, color = Species)) +   ggplot2::geom_point(size = 5, alpha = 0.3) +   ggpubr::theme_pubr() +   scale_color_au(discrete = T) +   ggplot2::ggtitle("Built-in discrete color scale") +   ggplot2::theme(plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(hjust = 0.5))  discrete_custom = ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(x = Petal.Width, y = Petal.Length, color = Species)) +   ggplot2::geom_point(size = 5, alpha = 0.3) +   ggpubr::theme_pubr() +   scale_color_au(discrete = T, style = "custom", colors = c("yellow", "magenta", "darkblue")) +   ggplot2::ggtitle("Custom discrete color scale") +   ggplot2::theme(plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(hjust = 0.5))  cont_cols = ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(x = Petal.Width, y = Petal.Length, color = Petal.Length)) +   ggplot2::geom_point(size = 5, alpha = 0.3) +   ggpubr::theme_pubr() +   scale_color_au(discrete = F, style = "hotandcold") +   ggplot2::ggtitle("Built-in continuous color scale") +   ggplot2::theme(plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(hjust = 0.5))  cont_custom = ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(x = Petal.Width, y = Petal.Length, color = Petal.Length)) +   ggplot2::geom_point(size = 5, alpha = 0.3) +   ggpubr::theme_pubr() +   scale_color_au(discrete = F, style = "custom", colors = c("darkblue", "yellow", "magenta")) +   ggplot2::ggtitle("Custom continuous color scale") +   ggplot2::theme(plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(hjust = 0.5))  cowplot::plot_grid(discrete_cols, discrete_custom, cont_cols, cont_custom)

title: ggplot2 themes for Aarhus University
text: Additionally color schemes, ggAU also includes commonly used visualization types pre-applied AU styles.

title: ggplot2 themes for Aarhus University
text: function many customization options, however, specifying data, x_val y_val enough getting basic plot running.
code: minimal = violinplotter(data = iris, x_val =  "Species", y_val = "Petal.Width",                         title = "Minimal example")  minimal_filtered = violinplotter(data = iris, x_val =  "Species", y_val = "Petal.Width",                                  filter = T, filter_col = "Species", filter_val = c("setosa", "virginica"),                                  title = "Minimal filtered example")  full_custom = violinplotter(data = iris, x_val =  "Species", y_val = "Petal.Width",                              x_lab = "Species", y_lab = "Petal width",                              title = "Fully customized example",                             filter = F, filter_col = NA, filter_val = NA,                             comp_vec = list(c("setosa", "virginica"),                                              c("setosa", "versicolor"),                                              c("virginica", "versicolor")),                             col_style = "custom",  fill_style = "custom",                              col_vec = c("red", "blue", "green"),                              fill_vec = c("red", "blue", "green"),                             display_n = F)  cowplot::plot_grid(minimal, minimal_filtered, full_custom, nrow = 1)

title: ggplot2 themes for Aarhus University
text: function creates bar plot displays Fisher’s test p-value subtitle. Similarly violinplotter, many customization options available, specifying data, x_lab y_lab sufficient creating basic plot.
code: # modifying the iris data to include two categorical variables iris = iris %>%   dplyr::mutate(Petal_mean = ifelse(Petal.Length > mean(Petal.Length), "above_mean", "below_mean"))  minimal_barplot = barplotter(data = iris, x_val = "Species", y_val = "Petal_mean",                              labcol = "white")  full_custom_barplot = barplotter(data = iris, x_val = "Species", y_val = "Petal_mean",                                  order = c("virginica", "setosa", "versicolor"),                                  scale_labs = c("Virginica", "Setosa", "Versicolor"),                                  pct = FALSE, style = "custom", colors = c("darkblue", "magenta"),                                  y_lab = "Number of individuals", x_lab = "",                                  title = "Comparing the petal lengths of different\nspecies",                                  labcol = "white", legend_lab = "Petal length category",                                  labels = c("Above mean", "Below mean"))  cowplot::plot_grid(minimal_barplot, full_custom_barplot)

title: ggplot2 themes for Aarhus University
text: function creates scatterplot, fits smooth linear line data, calculates correlation. Similarly violinplotter, many customization options available, specifying data, x_lab y_lab sufficient creating basic plot.
code: minimal_scatterplot = scatterplotter(iris, "Sepal.Width", "Sepal.Length",                                      linecolor = au_colors("darkred"),                                       pointcolor = au_colors("darkblue"),                                      fit = "single")  full_custom_scatterplot = scatterplotter(iris, "Sepal.Width", "Sepal.Length",                                           col_val = "Species", style = "custom",                                          colors = c("trxred", "trxblue", "trxyellow"),                                          y_lab = "Sepal Length", x_lab = "Sepal Width",                                           title = "Comparing sepal widths and lengths per\nspecies",                                           fit = "grouped", corr_method = "pearson",                                           alternative = "two.sided", fit_method = "lm",                                          se = FALSE, formula = "y ~ x",                                          legend_lab = "Species", discrete = TRUE,                                          labels = c("Species 1", "Species 2", "Species 3"),                                          pointsize = 5, point_alpha = 0.7)  cowplot::plot_grid(minimal_scatterplot, full_custom_scatterplot)

title: ggplot2 themes for Aarhus University
text: function creates volcano plot, allows flexible labelling. Similarly violinplotter, many customization options available, specifying data, x_lab y_lab sufficient creating basic plot.
code: minimal_volcanoplot = volcanoplotter(volcanodata, x_val = "logFC", y_val = "adj.P.Val")  full_custom_volcanoplot = volcanoplotter(volcanodata, x_val = "logFC", y_val = "adj.P.Val",                                           nonsig_col = "grey", pointsize = 3, point_alpha = 0.5,                                           y_lab = "P-value (FDR-adjusted)", x_lab = "log10(fold change)",                                           title = "Differential expression analysis",                                          sig_neg_col = au_colors("trxblue"),                                           sig_pos_col = au_colors("trxred"),                                          pval_cutoff = 0.05, add_labels = TRUE, num_lab = 10,                                          label_col = "SYMBOL", lab_size = 3, dirs = "y", nudge_x1 = 10,                                          nudge_x2 = -10, nudge_y1 = 0, nudge_y2 = 0, lab_bordersize = NA,                                          fillcol =  scales::alpha(c("white"), 0),                                          segment.size = 0.2, max.overlaps = 100, label.padding = 0.1,                                          lim = c(1, 1e-11))  cowplot::plot_grid(minimal_volcanoplot, full_custom_volcanoplot)

title: Color palette generator — au_color_palette
text: Helper function generate branded color palettes.

title: Color palette generator — au_color_palette
code: au_color_palette(style = "light", reverse = FALSE, colors = NA)

title: Color palette generator — au_color_palette
text: style String, name pre-defined color palette (light, dark, hotandcold, hotandcold_dark, tracerx), custom. default palette light. reverse Boolean, TRUE reverse color order. colors Vector AU color names. used style = "custom" passed .

title: Color palette generator — au_color_palette
text: named vector pre-defined custom color palette.

title: Color palette generator — au_color_palette
code: au_color_palette("hotandcold") #>      blue     white       red  #> "#003d73" "#ffffff" "#e2001a"   au_color_palette("custom", colors = c("yellow", "magenta", "white")) #>    yellow   magenta     white  #> "#fabb00" "#e2007a" "#ffffff"

title: Aarhus University brand colors — au_colors
text: Helper function retrieve arbitrary number AU brand colors name. Returns named vector containing color name(s) passed function, corresponding AU hex code(s).

title: Aarhus University brand colors — au_colors
code: au_colors(...)

title: Aarhus University brand colors — au_colors
text: ... Name(s) color(s) used. Valid color names: blue, darkblue, purple, darkpurple, cyan, darkcyan, turkis, darkturkis, green, darkgreen, yellow, darkyellow, orange, darkorange, red, darkred, magenta, darkmagenta, grey, darkgrey, white, trxred, trxlightred, trxblue, trxlightblue, trxyellow, trxpalegreen.

title: Aarhus University brand colors — au_colors
text: named vector chosen colors corresponding hex codes.

title: Aarhus University brand colors — au_colors
text: Implementation based official brand guidelines.

title: Aarhus University brand colors — au_colors
code: au_colors("red", "blue") #>       red      blue  #> "#e2001a" "#003d73"

title: Create barplots — barplotter
text: Enables creation barplots convenient customizable manner, calculates associated Fisher's test p-value count data.

title: Create barplots — barplotter
code: barplotter(   data,   x_val,   y_val,   order = NA,   scale_labs = ggplot2::waiver(),   pct = T,   style = "light",   colors = NA,   y_lab = ggplot2::waiver(),   x_lab = ggplot2::waiver(),   title = "",   labcol = "black",   display_n = T,   legend_lab = NA,   labels = NA )

title: Create barplots — barplotter
text: data data.frame used visualization. x_val string, name column plot x axis. y_val string, name column plot y axis. order vector, order bars appear. include unique values x_val desired order. unspecified, bars follow order dataframe. scale_labs vector, names display x axis ticks. default, shows names appear x_val. pct boolean, TRUE, percentages displayed bars, FALSE, absolute numbers shown. style string, palette style used scale_fill_au. Default light. Style applied colors remains NA. colors vector containing colors used fill aesthetic. Default NA. unspecified, function uses au_colors(). y_lab string, y axis label. Default percent. pct = FALSE, default number. x_lab string, x axis label. Default string passed x_val. title string, title plot displayed top. Deafult "". labcol string, color annotation numbers displayed inside bars. default black. display_n boolean, TRUE, plot displays sample size appended title. Default TRUE. legend_lab string, legend title. Default string passed y_val. labels vector, legend annotations. Default unique values y_val.

title: Create barplots — barplotter
text: ggplot object.

title: Create barplots — barplotter
code: iris = dplyr::mutate(iris, Petal_mean = ifelse(Petal.Length > mean(Petal.Length), "above_mean", "below_mean"))  barplotter(data = iris, x_val = "Species", y_val = "Petal_mean", labcol = "white")

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling rhs(lhs).

title: AU color scale — scale_color_au
text: Enables customization color aesthetic using pre-defined custom AU color palettes.

title: AU color scale — scale_color_au
code: scale_color_au(   style = "light",   reverse = FALSE,   discrete = FALSE,   colors = NA,   na.value = au_colors("grey"),   ... )

title: AU color scale — scale_color_au
text: style String, color palette style. light, dark, hotandcold, hotandcold_dark, custom. Default palette light. reverse Boolean, TRUE reverses color order. discrete Boolean, TRUE applies discrete color scale, FALSE applies continuous color scale. Default FALSE. colors Vector AU color names. used style = "custom" passed . na.value String named vector, color use NA values. Default au_colors("grey"), corresponding #878787. ... Arguments passed scale_color_manual scale_color_gradientn.

title: AU color scale — scale_color_au
text: ggproto ScaleContinuous ScaleDiscrete object.

title: AU color scale — scale_color_au
code: ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(x = Petal.Width, y = Petal.Length, color = Species)) + ggplot2::geom_point(size = 5, alpha = 0.3) + ggpubr::theme_pubr() + scale_color_au(discrete = TRUE)

title: AU fill scale — scale_fill_au
text: Enables customization fill aesthetic using pre-defined custom AU color palettes.

title: AU fill scale — scale_fill_au
code: scale_fill_au(   style = "light",   reverse = FALSE,   discrete = FALSE,   colors = NA,   na.value = au_colors("grey"),   ... )

title: AU fill scale — scale_fill_au
text: style String, color palette style. light, dark, hotandcold, hotandcold_dark, custom. Default palette light. reverse Boolean, TRUE reverses color order. discrete Boolean, TRUE applies discrete color scale, FALSE applies continuous color scale. Default FALSE. colors Vector AU color names. used style = "custom" passed . na.value String named vector, color use NA values. Default au_colors("grey"), corresponding #878787. ... Arguments passed scale_fill_manual scale_fill_gradientn.

title: AU fill scale — scale_fill_au
text: ggproto ScaleContinuous ScaleDiscrete object.

title: AU fill scale — scale_fill_au
code: iris_df = dplyr::summarize(dplyr::group_by(iris, Species), `Mean petal width` = mean(Petal.Width))  ggplot2::ggplot(iris_df, ggplot2::aes(x = Species, y = `Mean petal width`, fill = Species)) + ggplot2::geom_bar(stat = "identity") + ggpubr::theme_pubr() + scale_fill_au(discrete = TRUE, style = "light")

title: Create scatterplots — scatterplotter
text: Enables creation scatterplots convenient customizable manner. Additionally, allows user calculate correlation metric interest, fit linear loess line data.

title: Create scatterplots — scatterplotter
code: scatterplotter(   data,   x_val,   y_val,   col_val = NA,   style = "light",   colors = NA,   y_lab = y_val,   x_lab = x_val,   title = "",   legend_lab = "",   fit = "none",   discrete = TRUE,   linecolor = "black",   pointcolor = "black",   corr_method = "pearson",   alternative = "two.sided",   fit_method = "glm",   se = FALSE,   labels = NA,   formula = "y ~ x",   pointsize = 1,   point_alpha = 1,   display_n = T,   ... )

title: Create scatterplots — scatterplotter
text: data data.frame used visualization. x_val string, name column plot x axis. y_val string, name column plot y axis. col_val string, name column use coloring points. Default NA. style string, palette style used scale_color_au. Default light. Style applied colors remains NA. colors vector containing colors used fill aesthetic. Default NA. unspecified, function uses au_colors(). y_lab string, y axis label. Default string passed y_val. x_lab string, x axis label. Default sting passed x_val. title string, title plot displayed top. Default "". legend_lab string, legend title. Default color. fit string, single, grouped, none. using single, model fit entire dataset displayed plot. grouped used, separate line fit groups defined col_val. none selected, line fit. Default none. discrete boolean, TRUE applies discrete color scale, FALSE applies continuous color scale. Default TRUE. linecolor string, color fitted line single mode. Default black. pointcolor sting, color use points col_val = NA.Default black. corr_method string, correlation method pass stat_cor(). Default pearson. alternative string, alternative pass stat_cor(). Default two.sided. fit_method string, fitting method passed geom_smooth(). Default glm. se boolean, TRUE, confidence interval around fitted line displayed. Default FALSE. labels vector, legend annotations. Default unique values y_val. formula string, formula use fitting line geom_smooth(). Default y ~ x. pointsize num, point size passed geom_point(). Default 1. point_alpha num, point opacity passed geom_point(). Default 1. display_n boolean, TRUE, plot displays sample size appended title. Default TRUE. sample size calculated basis number rows data frame, ensure observations data unique calling scatterplotter. ... parameters passed stat_cor().

title: Create scatterplots — scatterplotter
text: ggplot object.

title: Create scatterplots — scatterplotter
code: scatterplotter(iris, "Sepal.Width", "Sepal.Length",col_val = "Species", style = "tracerx", y_lab = "Sepal Length", x_lab = "Sepal Width",  title = "Comparing sepal widths and lengths per species", fit = "single", corr_method = "pearson", legend_lab = "Species", se = FALSE, labels = c("Species 1", "Species 2", "Species 3"))

title: Create violin-boxplots — violinplotter
text: Enables creation violin-boxplots convenient customizable manner.

title: Create violin-boxplots — violinplotter
code: violinplotter(   data,   x_val,   y_val,   x_lab = x_val,   y_lab = y_val,   title = "",   filter = F,   filter_col = NA,   filter_val = NA,   comp_vec = NA,   col_vec = NA,   scale_labs = ggplot2::waiver(),   fill_vec = NA,   col_style = "light",   fill_style = "light",   display_n = T,   violin_alpha = 0.5 )

title: Create violin-boxplots — violinplotter
text: data data.frame used visualization. x_val string, name column plot x axis. y_val string, name column plot y axis. x_lab string, x axis label. Default string passed x_val. y_lab string, y axis label. Default string passed y_val. title string, title plot displayed top. Default "". filter boolean, TRUE, allows filtering data. Default FALSE. filter_col string, name column filter filter = TRUE. Default NA. filter_val vector, values keep filter = TRUE. comp_vec list vectors containing comparisons passed stat_compare_means. Default NA, case, comparisons made. col_vec vector containing colors used color aesthetic. Default NA. unspecified, function uses au_colors(). scale_labs vector, names display x axis ticks. default, shows names appear x_val. fill_vec vector containing colors used fill aesthetic. Default NA. unspecified, function uses au_colors(). col_style string, palette style used scale_color_au. Default light. Style applied col_vec remains NA. fill_style string, palette style used scale_fill_au. Default light. Style applied fill_vec remains NA. display_n boolean, TRUE, plot displays sample size appended title. Default TRUE. violin_alpha num, opacity violin plot. Default 0.5.

title: Create violin-boxplots — violinplotter
text: ggplot object.

title: Create violin-boxplots — violinplotter
code: violinplotter(data = iris, x_val =  "Species", y_val = "Petal.Width", display_n = FALSE)   violinplotter(data = iris, x_val = "Species", y_val = "Petal.Width", filter = TRUE, filter_col = "Species", filter_val = c("setosa", "virginica"), comp_vec = list(c("setosa", "virginica")), title = "Comparing Setosa and Virginica")

title: Volcano plot data — volcanodata
text: dataset containing results differential expression analysis performed using limma-voom. created Maria Doyle Visualization RNA-Seq results Volcano Plot tutorial.

title: Volcano plot data — volcanodata
code: volcanodata

title: Volcano plot data — volcanodata
text: data frame 15,804 rows 8 columns: ENTREZID gene's Entrez ID SYMBOL Gene symbol GENENAME Gene name function logFC Log fold change, quantifying differential expression AveExpr Average gene expression t t-statistic calculated limma-voom P.value p-value adj.P.val adjusted p-value

title: Volcano plot data — volcanodata
text: https://zenodo.org/record/2529117

title: Volcanoplotter — volcanoplotter
text: Enables convenient visualization differential expression data.

title: Volcanoplotter — volcanoplotter
code: volcanoplotter(   data,   x_val,   y_val,   nonsig_col = "grey",   pointsize = 1,   point_alpha = 1,   y_lab = "P-value",   x_lab = "logFC",   title = "",   sig_neg_col = au_colors("blue"),   sig_pos_col = au_colors("red"),   pval_cutoff = 0.05,   add_labels = FALSE,   num_lab = 10,   label_col = NA,   lab_size = 3,   dirs = "y",   nudge_x1 = 10,   nudge_x2 = -10,   nudge_y1 = 0,   nudge_y2 = 0,   lab_bordersize = NA,   fillcol = scales::alpha(c("white"), 0),   brk = ggplot2::waiver(),   display_n = T,   lim = NULL,   ... )

title: Volcanoplotter — volcanoplotter
text: data data.frame used visualization. x_val string, name column plot x axis. y_val string, name column plot y axis. nonsig_col string, color use nonsignificant points. Default grey. pointsize num, point size passed geom_point(). Default 1. point_alpha num, point opacity passed geom_point(). Default 1. y_lab string, y axis label. Default P-value. x_lab string, x axis label. Default logFC. title string, title plot displayed top. Default "". sig_neg_col string, color use significant negative points. Default au_colors("blue"). sig_pos_col string, color use significant positive points. Default au_colors("red"). pval_cutoff num, significance cutoff. Default 0.05. add_labels boolean, TRUE, number points determined num_lab labelled. Default FALSE. num_lab num, number points label plot. Default 10. label_col string, name column use labelling. Default NA. lab_size num, size labels. Default 3. dirs string, direction position adjustment passed geom_label_repel(). Possible values x, y . Default x. nudge_x1 num, horizontal adjustment positive significant labels. Default 10. nudge_x2 num, horizontal adjustment negative significant labels. Default -10. nudge_y1 num, vertical adjustment positive significant labels. Default 0. nudge_y2 num, vertical adjustment negative significant labels. Default 0. lab_bordersize num, width label border. Default NA. fillcol string, background color labels. Default transparent. brk vector, list y-axis breaks. lim vector, y-axis limits. ... parameters passed geom_label_repel().

title: Volcanoplotter — volcanoplotter
text: ggplot object.

title: Volcanoplotter — volcanoplotter
code: volcanoplotter(volcanodata, x_val = "logFC", y_val = "adj.P.Val", add_labels = TRUE, label_col = "SYMBOL", num_lab = 5)
